attributes.action: Revoke the decision to remove the second fire engine from Oakham Fire Station.
attributes.background: Removing the second fire engine and retained crew from Oakham Fire Station will mean slower response times to emergencies, which will have a significant impact, putting life and property at greater risk in Rutland and surrounding areas. The removal of the fire engine is to take place on 31/03/16.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The fire service is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillor

Your local council also has a petitions process - you can find out more about it here:

http://www.rutland.gov.uk/council_and_democracy/councillors_and_democracy/petitions.aspx
